text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: football : midfielder available for burton 's fulham game
text: burton albion manager nigel clough is unlikely to make many changes for their game against fulham after tuesday 's 0-0 draw with norwich .
liam boyce is still injured , but midfielder hope akpan is available having returned from suspension .
burton have faced fulham three times previously in all competitions and are yet to win against the cottagers .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: car key burglaries 'on the rise ' in staffordshire
text: burglaries in which car keys are stolen to then steal the vehicles are on the increase in staffordshire , police say .
the county 's police force says it 's been a particular issue in penkridge , wombourne and codsall but say they 've had reports from across the patch .
to tackle it , they say they 're working with other groups including west midlands police and south staffordshire district council , as well as having patrols out in marked and unmarked cars .
author: Jennie Aitken
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: weather : some showers tomorrow , but sunday looking dry
text: we 're going to have a few more showers tomorrow afternoon , but it 's looking a lot drier on sunday .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: police officer convicted of fraud
text: a serving staffordshire police officer 's been convicted of fraud today after a two-week trial .
david gimbert , 37 , from mow cop , was found guilty at birmingham crown court of one count of conspiracy to defraud .
staffordshire police says the case followed an allegation relating to incidents between november 2002 and october 2004 .
another defendent , john david gimbert , 65 , of westwood park avenue , leek , was also convicted of one count of conspiracy to defraud .
the pair will be sentenced on 6 october .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: heart of england in bloom awards for staffordshire communities
text: towns , villages and even a city in staffordshire have all won gold awards in the heart of england in bloom competition .
one of them , newcastle-under-lyme , won outright in the small city ( over 35k ) category .
among the other gold winners were lichfield , tamworth , uttoxeter and great haywood .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : crash blocks two lanes of a38 in staffordshire
text: two lanes of the a38 in staffordshire are blocked this evening , police say , due to a crash .
staffordshire police says it 's happened on the southbound side just after the barton-under-needwood turning .

documents.title: football : 'flexible ' striker proves a hit for stoke city boss
text: mark hughes has praised his stoke city striker mame diouf for his versatility after he signed a new three-year contract .
diouf has made 99 appearances - scoring 19 goals - since arriving at stoke from bundesliga side hannover in 2014 .
manager hughes told reporters today the 29-year-old 's flexibility helps him during games .
we have a couple of players who have the flexibility to play in different positions , like geoff cameron , and that helps you during games when you can move people around and keep 11 on the pitch .
we 're delighted that mame has committed to us
author: Matt Sandoz
Stoke City commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: charity could shut after break-ins
text: a cannock charity could be shutting down after six break-ins in two years .
dads and disability support is run by parents and carers who have children with special needs and disabilities , providing a safe space for support .
last week a wood chipper worth £ 3,500 was stolen from its furniture shop .
author: Louise Hancock
Newsreader, BBC WM

staffordshire police says they were pulled over in sunnyside avenue , tunstall , this morning by officers who could see none of them were wearing seatbelts .
they say the car was also using false plates .
officers reported the father for allowing the 15-year-old to drive with no licence and no insurance while the teenager was reported for driving with no licence and no insurance .
the minimum age to hold a full car licence is 17 , or 16 for some people claiming mobility benefit .

documents.title: a500 widening plans set for public opinion
text: six weeks of public consultation on plans to widen the a500 between the m6 and crewe will start next week .
crewe town council says it 'll begin on 20 september and , on the same date , there 'll be a full presentation on the dualling scheme at the village hall in barthomley .
the authority says the consultation is ahead of a planning application for the scheme by cheshire east council .
last year , cheshire east council was given £ 2m by the government towards the scheme which , overall , is estimated to be likely to cost £ 57m .
consultation on dualling of a500 , more via @ twitterid website .
i did n't realise there was still consultation ongoing for this , thought it was done and dusted .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: badger culling begins in 21 areas of england
text: badger culling has begun in 21 areas across england as part of efforts to tackle tuberculosis in cattle .
the scheme was expanded this year to 11 new areas in devon , wiltshire , somerset , dorset and cheshire , and could see up to 33,000 badgers killed .
the government claims culling badgers will curb tb in cattle and said it was committed to the culling trials .
opponents say culling is inhumane and vaccinating badgers would be more effective in preventing tb 's spread .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: knife charge after college 'locked down '
text: a teenager 's been charged with carrying a knife in public after an incident this week outside burton college which saw the site `` locked down '' .
a spokeperson for the college says nobody was hurt on tuesday and they quickly got back to normal after the police arrived just after 13:00 .
staffordshire police today said a 17-year-old male from burton 's been charged with possession of a knife in a public place .
after an incident at burton college on tues 12 sep , a 17yr-old man from burton has been charged with possession of a knife in a public place
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: long delays for local passengers as railway line reopens
text: there 's good news for train users in staffordshire and cheshire heading to london euston station as the line has reopened after an overnight fire in the harrow area .
the west coast main line between milton keynes and euston was closed for several hours , affecting routes to the midlands , north of england , scotland and north wales .
engineers had to repair a fire damaged wall near the affected line , which has been made safe , network rail said .
one train operator , london midland , tweeted that while the line had reopened at 13:00 , passengers should expect delays and cancellations while services recover .
lines have reopened , however still expect delays/cancellations whilst we are in recovery , check journey planners for updates

it is running at present steve
author: BBC News England

documents.title: m54 link road plans : ancient woodland impact from one option
text: ancient staffordshire woodland could be in the path of a new link road under one option to connect the m54 with the m6 and m6 toll .
highways england has produced three options for the route , which is aimed at stopping drivers having to leave the m54 and use local a-roads in order to get to the other motorways .
a consultation 's started today on the three routes and one of them , option c east , would see the existing m54 widened from junction one towards the m6 .
but highways england says that choice would then see it `` affecting '' areas of ancient woodland at burn 's wood , spring cop and keeper 's wood .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: struck-off surgeon 'could have harmed more patients '
text: solicitors representing the victims of a facial surgeon , who 's been struck off the medical register , believe more needs to be done to identify all the patients he harmed .
roger bainton carried out experimental and unnecessary surgery .
the university hospitals of north midlands nhs trust says it 's identified 88 patients .
but lawyers say mr bainton was operating in stoke-on-trent for nine years , so there could be more .
author: Michele Paduano
Health correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: football : concussion keeping crewe loanee on sidelines
text: crewe alexandra will again be without their loan signing conor grant this weekend .
the everton midfielder suffered concussion on his debut at grimsby 12 days ago and is still unavailable .
risk something like that , you do n't know what it 's going to lead to .
when they say to err on the side of caution , you most definitely do in those situations .
the advice is quite clear , they should be out for two weeks
author: Graham McGarry
Crewe Alexandra commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: 'walk of fame ' artwork planned for famous stoke-on-trent people
text: a stoke-on-trent `` walk of fame '' artwork 's going to be created as part of the city 's bid to be uk city of culture 2021 .
the lead artist at the airspace gallery in hanley , anna francis , is running the project in connection with the city council .
she says she wants people to suggest notable people with a strong connection to stoke-on-trent who could be celebrated in the artwork , called `` the people 's walk of fame '' .
the idea is then for the nominations to be shortlisted for a public online poll and the planned artwork would be installed in hanley in 2018 .
author: Chris King
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: waitrose closure means post office relocation
text: the main post office in leek is set to relocate as its current property , at the local waitrose , will shut along with the supermarket .
waitrose is pulling out because it says the store has n't made a profit since it opened .
the post office says the branch there will shut on 22 september but it is `` close to finalising the details '' of relocating it to the high street .
but it says it first of all has to hold a six-week consultation before it can reopen there .
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: police not ruling out link between digger ram-raids
text: police in cheshire say they 're not ruling out the possibility a ram-raid in cheshire on a convenience store could be linked to ones in staffordshire and derbyshire .
a stolen telescopic handler was used to take the cash machine at sainsbury 's local , in common lane , culcheth , on wednesday , a cheshire police spokesman said .

last month , there was an unsuccessful attempt to steal a cash machine in kings bromley , staffordshire , followed by a successful robbery in nearby hatton , both using vehicles which damaged the stores .
cheshire police says its officers are looking into whether the robberies could all be linked .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : stoke skipper 'touch and go ' to make newcastle game
text: stoke city manager mark hughes says it 'll be `` touch and go '' as to whether club skipper ryan shawcross will be fit for their game at newcastle united tomorrow .
he missed the draw with manchester united last weekend after suffering a injury .
it 's touch and go with ryan for this weekend .
he 's missed a bit of training time unfortunately .
we 'll check him again today .
he may come in with a really positive attitude to the weekend , but as we stand as of last evening it is unlikely he will play
author: Graham McGarry
BBC Radio Stoke Sport

documents.title: lichfield man describes parsons green tube explosion
text: a man from lichfield aboard a tube train on which there was an explosion this morning said he saw people with burns injuries .
eyewitness luke o'connor also described `` a strong smell '' following the `` loud explosion '' on the district line train to which emergency services were called at about 08:20 .
mr o'connor told bbc wm the train was pulling into parsons green station in fulham .
he said : `` [ there was ] a loud explosion i use the expression sort of sulphuric acid , when you go into science lab at school , that type of smell .
`` [ there ] appeared to be some injuries sort of burning injuries by the look of it . ''

there [ were ] lots of school kids on there , mothers doing the school run i was sitting next to a girl who was just doing her spellings , people just getting ready for the day it was just more of a shock really .
you never expect it to happen . ''
mr o'connor said tube staff were `` superb '' and helped people off the train safely and as quickly as possible .

documents.title: route options for m54 link road on display
text: three options for a link road connecting the m54 with the m6 and m6 toll are going on show to the public today .
traffic currently travels up a roads and highways england says a link road would take about 22,000 vehicles a day off the a460 and relieve congestion through places such as featherstone .
it also says the link road would support economic growth in the area by making it more accessible .
consultation on the three route options will continue until 13 october .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : lane shut on m6 near stoke-on-trent

documents.title: football : port vale supporting manager despite fans calling for sack
text: port vale say they continuing to support manager michael brown despite calls from some fans for him to be sacked after a miserable run of six successive league defeats .
vale have failed to score in six league and cup games .
but chief executive colin garlick says brown will still be in charge when vale host forest green on saturday .
michael 's the manager , so we just carry on with it .
we 're not fools .
we can see what 's going on .
all we 're doing at the moment is supporting the manager and his players .
everyone else is speculating
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: staffordshire pcc 'not thinking ' job cuts to meet police pay rise
text: staffordshire 's police and crime commissioner ( pcc ) says he will try to meet an increase in pay for police officers without cutting staff .
this week , the government said police officers would get a 1 % rise plus a 1 % bonus as it lifted the cap on public sector pay rises .

that brought a response from staffordshire 's chief constable gareth morgan on twitter that , as the increase had n't been budgeted for , it could lead to `` fewer cops who are slightly better paid '' .
however , the county 's pcc matthew ellis says he 's considering using the force 's financial reserves to pay for the rise .
i am angry about it because backward planning is not nearly as good as forward planning and it 's put me in a difficult situation .
but cops and resources will be the absolute last thing to go and i 'm not actually thinking like that at the moment
author: Jennie Aitken
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: residents call for relief road to severn trent 's strongford works
text: families fear a new green energy development at a sewage works will fuel traffic problems in their community .
author: The Sentinel

text: rail travellers from staffordshire and cheshire heading to london euston are facing severe disruption following a fire overnight at a factory and offices in north-west london .
there is no service on london midland , virgin trains and southern between milton keynes central and euston .
virgin trains to and from scotland , north-west england , the west midlands and north wales are starting or terminating at milton keynes .
london midland is advising passengers not to travel on the route .

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : mum touched by instagram post support
text: on midlands today this evening , we 'll hear the story of a stoke-on-trent mother who 's had huge public backing since she challenged the removal of a photo on social media .
the on instagram showed harry beswick without his prosthetic eye and the media giant 's now apologised .
i 've been to meet harry and his mum charlie and you 'll see their story from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Sarah Bishop
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: patients to be quizzed more over gp appointments
text: more training is going to be given to receptionists at gp practices in stoke-on-trent , to help patients in the city get better support .
the stoke-on-trent clinical commissioning group says 55 of the 77 practices in the area are currently signed up to their scheme .
the ccg says it means receptionists will be more able to help patients get good care .
author: Hazel Morgan
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: weather : more rain tonight and tomorrow
text: we are forecast more showers overnight and that weather is set to continue tomorrow , with the odd bright spell at times .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: man found dead 'had been taken to site in a skip '
text: a man whose body was found at an industrial estate in stoke-on-trent had been brought there in a skip full of recycling .
staffordshire police revealed adam forrester , 30 , of no fixed abode , was found on tuesday at the sneyd industrial estate , burslem .
the force says they 've been putting together his movements before then and say it 's possible he sought shelter or got into the skip for some reason .
officers say they are still waiting for the results of a post-mortem examination but are warning of the dangers of sleeping or sheltering in skips .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: public urged to 'dig deep ' for iron age gold
text: organisers of a campaign to raise £ 325,000 to buy the `` oldest '' iron age gold found in britain for public display are urging people to `` dig deep '' and back them .
the gold jewellery , believed to be about 2,500 years old , was discovered by friends mark hambleton and joe kania on staffordshire moorlands farmland .
stoke-on-trent city council has been given three months to buy the three necklaces and bracelet by the crown .
ian lawley , chairman of the friends of the potteries museum and art gallery says the pieces are unique and they 're want to secure their future for `` generations of people '' .
author: Matt Lee
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: stoke city transfer concerns raised in battle over betting
text: staffordshire mp and culture secretary karen bradley has dismissed calls from labour to ban betting firms ' involvement in football clubs .
opposition mps described it as a `` hidden epidemic of gambling addiction '' .
stoke city are among nine premier league clubs to have kits sponsored by betting companies and the potters ' stadium is named after bet365 .
ms bradley said ending all ties with betting firms would hit clubs hard and effectively prevent them from competing .

i think the supporters of stoke city would probably be quite concerned if they were to discover that their stadium perhaps could no longer be bet365 and their shirt sponsor and they may wonder where they would be able to purchase players from . ''
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: amazon worker admits taking more than £ 5,000 in perfume
text: an amazon worker stole more than £ 5,500 worth of perfume from the company 's rugeley warehouse as an `` act of revenge '' after becoming disgruntled .
author: Express and Star

documents.title: police confirm reason for ipcc referral over fatal crash
text: staffordshire police has today confirmed it referred itself to the official watchdog after a fatal crash in stoke-on-trent because they 'd previously been called to a `` domestic incident '' involving the victim .
today the force named the man as 35-year-old anthony hazlehurst , from the city - he died on tuesday when his honda motorbike crashed on glebe street .
officers say he was the only person involved in the collision .

the force says `` nothing happened '' in the domestic incident that needed police officers , but added that , as they did go to the home , they have voluntarily referred themselves to the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) .
the ipcc says it has n't yet decided if the incident needs investigating by its own staff .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

text: campaign to buy 'oldest ' iron age gold

documents.title: football : diouf signs new deal with stoke
text: the stoke city striker mame diouf 's signed a new three-year deal to stay at the club .
the 29-year-old 's existing deal was going to run out at the end of this season but he 'll now stay until at least 2020 .
he 's made 99 league and cup appearances for the potters and scored 19 goals .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: football : close game predicted for stoke 's newcastle visit
text: stoke city go to newcastle united this weekend , looking for their first win at st james ' park in seven years .
the potters are undefeated in their last three league games while newcastle have won their last two .
stoke city have had a great start , newcastle that little bit of an iffy start but they look like they 've hit a little bit of form now , two wins in the last two games .
it 's obviously at st james ' park so that place will be buzzing . ''
author: Matt Sandoz
Stoke City commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: mum touched by instagram post support
text: mum touched by instagram post support

documents.title: your say : praise for stoke city owner paying for hos extension
text: you 've been having your say on the news that the owner of stoke city 's agreed to pay for an extension to a children 's hos in stoke-on-trent to help over-19s with life-limiting conditions .
the donna louise trust says the money 's coming from denise coates 's charitable foundation and work should start in november .
on the bbc radio stoke facebook page , emma louise adams wrote : `` we 're actually in the donna louise right now for respite care , my four-year-old daughter has half a heart .
the difference the charity makes to our lives is unbelievable . ''

while christine underwood added : `` this is going to make a huge difference to the children who have spent a lot of their young lives at the hos and now have somewhere to enjoy their later lives in familiar surroundings . ''
and jane powell posted : `` having used the facilities when my daughter was dying from cancer , i know how important the hos is to families like ours. ``

text: burton taxi drivers are leaving their jobs as the closure of st peter 's bridge for repair work hits trade .

documents.title: railway line to be shut for three sundays
text: the railway between rugeley and wednesbury is going to be shut for three sundays in a row as a project continues to electrify the line .
london midland says it 'll start this sunday on the chase line between tame bridge parkway and rugeley trent valley .
the operator says there 'll be replacement buses instead .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hurricane irma : man 'lucky to be alive ' after hotel 'destroyed '
text: a man from staffordshire says he 's lucky to be alive after the hotel he works at was destroyed by hurricane irma .
anthony shepherd , from talke , has been living on the island of st martin which was hit by winds of over 160mph .
on the island , six out of 10 homes are now uninhabitable , french officials say .
both of the tower blocks of the hotel are completely and fundamentally compromised .
walls have blown off , whole floors have disappeared .
if we 'd not conducted the evacuation with the success that we did , without doubt we 'd be looking at a really long list of fatalities . ''
author: Liz Ellis
Presenter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: on bbc one tonight : i 'm more than 'that girl from alton towers '
text: if you tune in to bbc one this evening , you can see how vicky balch regained her independence after losing one of her legs following the alton towers roller coaster crash two years ago .
she 's travelled along vietnam 's ho chi minh trail , making it to hang chuot , or rat cave , which is notoriously hard to reach .
you can watch more of her trip in without limits : vietnam on bbc one on thursday 14 september at 20:00
author: BBC One

documents.title: instagram apology after removing photo showing boy without an eye
text: instagram has apologised after saying it `` mistakenly '' removed a photo of a 12-year-old stoke-on-trent boy shown without his eye .
harry beswick was born with goldenhar syndrome .
he is missing an eye , eye socket , nostril and ear from one side of his face .
his mother , charlie beswick posted a photo of harry without his prosthetic eye on monday and said it was later removed for `` breaching guidelines '' .
today , instagram said in a statement it had `` quickly restored '' the photo when they realised they 'd made a mistake and apologised to the beswick family .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: window firm buy-out 'saves ' 70 jobs
text: more than 70 jobs have been saved after a stoke-on-trent window manufacturer has been sold , weeks after going into administration .
fenton-based listers trade frames says it and its assets have been bought by gjb holdings .
in a statement on its website , director phil warren says the deal means a `` very secure future '' for the firm 's employees .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: work starts on pop-up hotel and wedding venue at former pottery works
text: major plans have been revealed to create a `` pop-up '' hotel and wedding venue at a former pottery factory undergoing renovations .

documents.title: three months to save iron age gold work for nation
text: jewellery , which could be the oldest iron age gold discovered in britain , could be sold to private bidders unless a fundraising campaign can raise £ 325,000 in three months .
three necklaces and a bracelet , called the leekfrith iron age torcs , are believed to be about 2,500 years old and were found last december in leekfrith by two friends who were metal detecting .
now , stoke-on-trent city council says they 've been valued by the treasure valuation committee at £ 325,000 .
the authority says it and the friends of the potteries museum and art gallery have until 5 december to meet the valuation price or risk them being separated and sold privately .
author: Matt Lee
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: stafford fireworks factory blaze : man denies charges
text: a man 's pleaded not guilty to causing the death of two people in a huge fire in stafford in 2014 .
richard pearson , 43 , from rowley park in the town denied two counts of gross negligence manslaughter at stafford crown court this morning .
he owned sp plastics in baswich , which caught fire on 30 october 2014 .
simon hillier , 41 , and stewart staples , 57 , died in the blaze .
a date for his trial has been set for april .
author: Chris King
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: 'do n't be concerned ' over training exercise
text: people in the east of staffordshire are being warned there 'll be an increased number of emergency services around today because of a training exercise .
staffordshire fire service says `` there is nothing to worry about '' , adding that it 's a routine one and not down to an specific threat to the county .
however , it says , with the uk terrorism threat level still at severe , it 's important crews are as prepared as possible .
for those of you in the eastern areas of the county , please do n't be concerned if you see a large amount of emergency vehicles today

documents.title: football : port vale talks over manager 's future
text: port vale 's owner and its chief executive are expected to be at vale park today to discuss the future of manager michael brown .

however brown told bbc radio stoke that their results are n't reflecting their performances .

documents.title: work starting monday on lichfield 's new library
text: work to build a brand new £ 1.2m library in lichfield will start on monday .
staffordshire county council says it 'll involve opening up the ground floor of st mary 's church on market square to host both the library and the tourist information service .
it says the first floor will also house a permanent museum , exhibition and performance space .

the force says his family have been told but they do n't yet know what caused his death and are waiting for the results of a post-mortem examination .

text: officials at the national memorial arboretum say a memorial dedicated to uk victims of terrorism overseas should be installed by the end of the year and dedicated next spring .
designs for the sculpture , called still water , were revealed earlier this week and the government says it aims to commemorate all uk citizens who have been killed in terrorist attacks overseas .
the managing director of the arboretum says , as well as marking terrorism deaths , it will provide a `` spiritually uplifting opportunity for remembrance '' .

documents.title: ian paterson : spire healthcare to pay out £ 27m to victims
text: private healthcare firm spire has agreed to pay £ 27.2m into a fund to compensate the victims of rogue breast surgeon ian paterson .
paterson was found guilty of 17 counts of wounding with intent in april after a trial at nottingham crown court .
the payment concerns up to 750 victims treated privately in the west midlands .
they include frances perks from burntwood , staffordshire and gill dallow from lichfield , both of who have spoken to the bbc about the treatment they received .
in august , paterson had his 15-year jail term increased to 20 years and was convicted of three further wounding charges .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: unemployment falls
text: latest unemployment figures show the number of people out of work across the west midlands fell by 2,000 in the three months to july .
a total of 164,000 were out of work .
nationally the number of jobless now stands at 1.46 million - its lowest level since 1975 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: market set for 'biggest ' revamp in 30-year history
text: the indoor market in hanley , stoke-on-trent is going to get a revamp to the tune of £ 1.5m .
the city council 's aiming to spend the money on making it a more attractive place to visit and say it 's the `` biggest single investment '' since the site opened in 1987 .
they say the plans are up for approval on 19 september and , after that , work will start on drawing up designs and getting feedback from stallholders .
author: Chris King
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: charity gives teddy bears to bereaved parents
text: bereaved parents in the west midlands are being given teddy bears .
in the last year , the charity aching arms says it has given out more than 300 bears to eight hospitals in the region .
they are being given to parents whose babies have died .
sarah osborn from stone suffered a miscarriage with her first child and now volunteers with the charity .
she says people may not realise how many miscarriages happen and they want to make sure parents are supported .

documents.title: stoke city owner pays for hos extension
text: a children 's hos in stoke-on-trent is getting a brand new extension after the owner of stoke city agreed to pay for it .

they had asked the denise coates foundation for a contribution towards it , but the woman herself agreed to pay for the whole facility .
work is set to start in november but the trust will have to find an extra £ 1m every year to find the service .

documents.title: council unable to stop all badger culling on its land
text: cheshire east council 's admitted it may not be able to stop badger culling from taking place on some of its land .
yesterday , the authority announced it would stop any badgers being culled on land it directly controls .
but the council says land that it rents out would not be included in that rule , including its tenanted farms .
it 's after the government this week issued a licence for a cull to take place in cheshire , as part of its 25-year strategy to eradicate bovine tb .
author: Phil McCann
Cheshire Political Reporter, BBC News

documents.title: pm backs birmigham 's bid to host 2022 commonwealth games
text: the conservative lichfield mp has asked the prime minister to back birmingham 's 2022 bid to host the commonwealth games over kuala lumpur , during this lunchtime 's pmqs .
michael fabricant asked : `` would the pm speak to the chancellor to ensure he backs the bid to see birmingham win the games over kuala lumpur ? ''
the commonwealth games being hosted in the uk in 2022 in birmingham would present a unique opportunity for the west midlands and it would of course promote global britain across the commonwealth .
the next step is for birmingham to demonstrate value for money in their bid but subject to that , i have no doubt birmingham will continue the uk 's rich history of hosting successful sporting events

they say he 's left them a legacy of £ 800,000 which is a `` significant contribution '' to the £ 15-£ 20m they need to raise over the next eight years .

text: burton albion manager nigel clough says he needed to see a response from his players after their 5-0 loss to leeds united and `` we got it '' at norwich city .
the brewers held the canaries to a goalless draw at carrow road to earn their first point away from home in 2017-18 and more out of the bottom three in the championship .
burton 's jamie allen went close to goal in the second-half while , at the other end , goalkeeper stephen bywater made two crucial saves to preserve their point .
we needed a response and we got it .
the players showed tremendous character to come to a difficult place like this and up a point .
it 's our first clean sheet , our first away point and gives us something to build on . ''

documents.title: football : brewers boss looking to up first away points
text: norwich city manager daniel farke has no new injury concerns , but may rotate his squad against burton albion .
the brewers have failed to up a point on the road this season , losing all three games .

documents.title: controversy-hit council insists government intervention is not needed
text: the government 's been told it does n't need to intervene in the running of cheshire east council , by the authority 's acting chief executive .
a number of residents ' groups have called for ministers to take action after a string of controversies .
the council 's three most senior managers are suspended amidst concerns over their conduct .
an investigation 's also trying to find out why some staff deliberately falsified pollution data .
cheshire east council insists it is putting its house in order '' .
author: Phil McCann
Cheshire Political Reporter, BBC News

documents.title: football : port vale boss keen to turn season around
text: port vale manager michael brown says a positive result at luton tonight could prove to be pivotal in their season .
vale have lost all of their last five league games and have n't scored a goal for exactly a month .
brown told bbc radio stoke that one good result is all that 's needed to turn the teams form around .

there are some supporters who are always going to have their opinion , they 're entitled to it , but the bulk of them supporters know that there are some good footballers and i think they 're certainly hoping we can turn the corner sooner rather than later . ''
luton vs port vale will be on bbc radio stoke tonight - kick off is at 19:45 , all the build up starts in sport at six .
author: Lee Blakeman
Port Vale commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

there could be gusts of up to 65 to 75 miles per hour .

documents.title: biker in 'cardiac arrest ' when paramedics arrived
text: a man has died after falling from his motorbike in stoke-on-trent last night .
west midlands ambulance service was called to glebe street at 23:55 .
a spokesman said crews arrived to find a motorcyclist in cardiac arrest having suffered serious injuries .
ambulance staff performed cpr and administered advanced life support but unfortunately it became apparent nothing could be done to save the man and he was confirmed deceased . ''

documents.title: green light given for multi-million pound investment in crewe
text: plans worth £ 48m to regenerate crewe town centre have been approved by cheshire east council 's ruling cabinet .
a cinema , restaurants and shops as well as a new bus station and car park on the current royal arcade site are among the proposals .
today 's decision means funding can be released and planning permission will now be applied for .
author: Phil McCann
Cheshire Political Reporter, BBC News

documents.title: breaking45 new hospital beds announced for royal stoke
text: a total of £ 2m is to be spent installing 45 new beds at the royal stoke hospital .
managers say 12 wards in the main building will get an additional three or four beds each .
they say they will help reduce the time patients wait to be sent onto wards from a and e , and also help the hospital to meet its targets for four-hour waiting times in accident and emergency .
author: Matt Lee
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: wildlife trust to extend ancient woodland in stoke-on-trent
text: stoke-on-trent 's biggest woodland is to grow further .
staffordshire wildlife trust has bought a 29-hectare extension of the hem heath woods nature reserve , previously part of the wedgwood estate .
the trust has been working for many years at hem heath to manage the site to make it better for wildlife and for people to visit and enjoy .
hem heath woods is an ancient woodland and home to a diverse range of woodland birds such as nuthatch , treecreeper and mistle thrush .
author: Jennie Aitken
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: football : forest and burton look to return to form
text: burton albion and nottingham forest will be looking to bounce back from chastening defeats over the weekend in tonight 's championship matches .

the brewers head to carrow road to take on norwich city fresh from their 5-0 hammering by high-flying leeds united , while forest are away at sunderland and hope for a better return than saturday 's 3-1 defeat to sheffield wednesday .
derby county , meanwhile , are in action in the efl cup , where they play away at barnsley , with the winner facing tottenham hotspur in the next round .
in league two , mansfield town host wycombe wanderers , while notts county take on swindon town at meadow lane .

the peak of the storm is due to hit in the early hours of wednesday with gusts of 65-75mph expected .

therefore i would advise all motorists to allow extra time for their journey on wednesday morning and take extra care while travelling . ''

documents.title: pear tree gifted to stoke-on-trent by people in village massacred by nazis
text: the 75th anniversary of the lidice massacre has been marked in stoke-on-trent .
the city 's compassion and generosity has been recognised by the former czechoslovakian village that it helped over 75 years ago .
the village of lidice had been massacred by the nazis and its buildings destroyed .
it was rebuilt with money raised by people in north staffordshire and this year , as a gesture of thanks , a pear tree has been gifted by the village to the city .
author: Phil Bowers
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: stafford among the best places to be a woman
text: 'sometimes it 's hard to be a woman , ' tammy wynette told us .
but not in stafford , according to some new research for bbc woman 's hour .
it says stafford is among the top 10 local authorities for women in great britain .
the factors considered by woman 's hour include things like income and personal well-being to access to quality schools and air quality .
it also looks at how safe women feel where they live and the local environment and culture .
the analysis divided women into three age groups : those under 30 ; 30 to 65 ; and over 65s .
author: Hazel Morgan
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

the crash happened at about 20:30 on cannock road , featherstone .
the woman , believed to be in her 20s , was taken to hospital after sustaining injuries to her arm and chest , west midlands ambulance service says .

documents.title: multi-million pound investment for crewe town centre on the table
text: a £ 48m plan to redevelop crewe town centre goes before cheshire east council later .
it 's suggested the royal arcade - on the left - could be replaced with a new cinema , shops , cafes and a gym .
there would also be a new bus station , and the market hall would be refurbished .
council leaders will discuss it at a meeting this afternoon .

Cheshire reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: biker dies after late-night crash in stoke
text: a motorcyclist has died following a crash in stoke-on-trent overnight .
the 35-year-old local man was on glebe street in stoke just after midnight when he was involved in a crash , police say .
the collision investigation unit has been at the scene .
staffordshire police is appealing for witnesses and the man 's family are being supported by specially trained officers .
the incident has been referred to the independent police complaints commission .

text: a former prisoner says staff and inmates will struggle in three of staffordshire 's prisons because of increased pressure whilst they 're completely full .
figures seen by bbc radio stoke have revealed dovegate , featherstone , and stafford prisons were at 100 % capacity at the end of july .
simon edwards spent seven-and-a-half years in jail for armed robbery and now runs a programme in north staffordshire which integrates people out of prison into society .
he told us a busy prison is n't a good thing and tensions can rise .
you 'd just notice that there was a tense time in the prison because everything just seemed full .
you just felt like no one had enough space . ''

the service says no one was hurt but it could have been worse , adding that the instructions for the toy did warn not to charge the battery on a flammable surface .

documents.title: badger culling gets go ahead in new areas of england
text: licences have been issued for badger culling in 11 new areas including in cheshire .
culling is part of the government 's 25-year strategy to eradicate bovine tb , but opponents say there is no evidence it is effective .
a badger vaccination programme to stop the spread of tb is restarting .
the badger trust condemned the policy as `` politically motivated ' and an `` insult to the nation 's intelligence '' .
the new licences have been granted by natural england .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: woman 'could have survived sepsis ' with earlier antibiotic treatment
text: a woman 's death from sepsis could have been prevented if a staffordshire hospital had given her antibiotics at an earlier stage , a world-leading expert in sepsis says .
margaret jackson was admitted to queen 's hospital , burton in 2015 with chest pains and a high temperature .
her husband says she deteriorated rapidly , although sepsis was not recorded as having contributed to mrs jackson 's death .
her treatment has been reviewed by dr ron daniels , chief executive of the sepsis trust , for bbc panorama and he says earlier use of antibiotics `` might have improved her chances of survival '' .
burton hospital says it has made vast improvements in the past six months and is now screening 98 % of in-patients .
panorama will investigate britain 's sepsis crisis on bbc one tonight from 20:30 .
author: BBC Panorama
Investigative TV show

documents.title: football : 'no discussions ' over future of port vale boss
text: port vale owner norman smurthwaite has confirmed today that he has n't spoken to the club 's chief executive colin garlick about the position of manager michael brown (
the pressure 's mounting on the vale boss as the side are on a five-game losing streak which has seen them sink to the bottom of the league two table .
they head to luton town tomorrow with brown saying he 's confident that his players can turn the club 's fortunes around .
i think we 're working very hard .
we 've changed the whole squad .
i do n't think we 're a million miles away with regards to other teams that are at this level although they 're getting the results , which is the difference . ''
author: Lee Blakeman
Port Vale commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: man accused of tamworth murder appears in court
text: a man charged with the murder of another man in tamworth will appear at stafford crown court later this week .
daniel wyatt , 30 , died from multiple stab wounds on friday evening on kerria road .
today , daniel alton , 27 , from bancroft , tamworth , appeared at cannock magistrates ' court accused of his murder .
he was remanded into custody to appear at the crown court on 13 september .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tunnel rescue man charged with burglary
text: a man who had to be rescued from a canal tunnel after he jumped into the water while being chased by police has been charged with burglary .
the 29-year-old from biddulph was pulled from harecastle canal tunnel , near kidsgrove , by firefighters on saturday .
today he was charged with one count of burglary dwelling and theft .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: written warnings for officers over taser death
text: two staffordshire police officers , found guilty of misconduct over the death of a man while under arrest in newcastle-under-lyme , have been given written warnings .
adrian mcdonald , 34 , died in 2014 from a cardiac arrest after being tasered by officers and bitten by a police dog , following his arrest for a suspected burglary .
medical experts concluded his death was not caused by police actions .
a panel today found sgt jason bromley and insp richard bills guilty of misconduct .
their written warnings will last for 12 months .
author: Emma Thomas
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : village holds ancient horn dance
text: an annual event , performed since the 13th century , has taken place today in the staffordshire village of abbots bromley .
the abbots bromley horn dance is held across several miles on wakes monday , the first monday after 4 september .
organisers say traditionally the dance was performed to `` ensure successful hunting '' .
today , the event attracts visitors from across the world .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police officers found guilty of misconduct over taser death
text: two staffordshire police officers have been found guilty of misconduct in a hearing over the death of a man while under arrest in newcastle-under-lyme .
adrian mcdonald ( 34 , died of a cardiac arrest in a police van after being tasered and bitten by a police dog during an arrest for suspected burglary in 2014 .
he was under the influence of drugs - medical experts concluded his death was not caused by police and would have died regardless of their actions .
sgt jason bromley and insp richard bills were cleared of the stronger allegation of `` gross misconduct '' because their actions did not contribute to mr mcdonald 's death .
the panel have yet to decide what action to take against the pair .
pc jonathan tench , also present at the arrest , was cleared of all allegations .
last month , the crown prosecution service decided not to bring criminal charges against the three officers saying there was `` insufficient '' evidence for a `` realistic prosecution '' .
author: Emma Thomas
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: abandoned cat 'struggling to survive '
text: a cat , found abandoned and barely able to walk in stoke-on-trent , is struggling to survive , the rspca says .
the charity says a group of children saw a woman dump the animal in wileman street on 31 august and she allegedly told them `` if you want to kill the cat , you could '' .
the rspca says the cat , nicknamed minnie , is also missing part of her tail and several teeth .
they say her health has n't improved since she was found .
author: Jennie Aitken
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

@ twitterid green watch tamworth belgrave remembering all those who lost their lives in the 9/11 attacks

documents.title: imam preached support for is , court told
text: a stoke-on-trent imam preached support for so-called islamic state during prayers at a mosque in the city , a court 's heard .
kamran hussain , of knightsbridge way , tunstall , is accused of eight charges , two of supporting is and six of encouraging terrorism between june and september last year .
today at the old bailey , jurors were told he 'd give sermons every friday at the mosque on tunstall high street .
the 40-year-old denies the charges and the case continues .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: five great views of staffordshire and cheshire
text: there are some lovely views in our selection of photos sent in by you , our audience .

documents.title: man rescued from flat after cooking catches fire
text: a man has been rescued from his flat after a fire in the kitchen .
he 'd left cooking unattended in the early hours of this morning in the apartment on hospital street , nantwich , cheshire fire service says .
fire crews put out the blaze and cleared the flat of smoke after rescuing him but it is unclear what sort of treatment the man needed .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: town centre traffic facing three weeks of roadworks
text: delays are expected in newcastle-under-lyme town centre from today as major roadworks begin .
the works on the northbound side of barracks road are part of a scheme to alter the road network around the new castle house development .
staffordshire county council says one lane will be closed while a lay-by is removed , the footpath widened and the entrance to the site resurfaced .
it says the work is expected to take about three weeks to finish .
author: Chris King
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: football : stoke player makes garth crooks ' team of the week
text: the performance of stoke city 's eric maxim choupo-moting in the club 's 2-2 draw with manchester united has earnt him a place in garth crooks 's team of the week on the bbc sport website .
he says he thought he looked like an interesting player who was likely to get his share of goals , lead the line and help the team win football matches .
garth says against manchester united , he did all of those things and looks to have returned energised from cameroon 's two gruelling world cup qualifiers .
read more of his thoughts here on the bbc website .

documents.title: fatal stab victim named
text: a man who was stabbed to death in tamworth on friday night has today been named by police .
staffordshire police says daniel wyatt , 30 , from sorrel in the town died last night after being stabbed several times on kerria road .
the force has charged a 27-year-old man from bancroft with his murder .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : burton 'could n't do too much ' about leed 's five goals
text: the burton albion boss nigel clough says he has to hail leeds united as `` excellent '' after seeing his side lose 5-0 to them at the weekend .
the brewers were 3-0 down by half-time and failed to add to their league-worst 12 shots on target .
clough suffered only his second defeat in nine games as a manager against the west yorkshire club .
we could n't do too much about the quality of the goals they scored .
it 's very rare you get a goalkeeper that 's conceded five goals and ca n't say he had a chance with any of them .
it 's the nature of burton albion in the championship .
we know we 're going to lose games . ''

documents.title: mental health charity facing closure : people 'need us '
text: a mental health charity facing closure is relied upon in the community , its chief executive says .
north staffs voice for mental health , based in hanley , has previously warned it could close before christmas after finding out it 's going to lose key funding .
the charity has been running for nearly 25 years and aims to make sure people who use mental health services are getting right and proper treatment .
but the stoke-on-trent and north staffordshire clinical commissioning groups ( ccgs ) decided to stop providing funding at the end of the month .
they say the charity does n't provide direct care and so does n't sufficiently support the ccgs ' priorities .
we are an organisation that has about 1,300 members across the area and we go out , day in , day out , speaking to people with mental health problems about the services that they receive . ''
author: Liz Ellis
Presenter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: warning of 65mph winds for west midlands this week
text: most parts of the west midlands could be hit by gusts of wind of up to 55-65mph later this week .
the met office has issued a yellow weather warning , running from 20:00 tomorrow until 10:00 on wednesday .
it says the winds could get up to 75mph in exposed places and that it 's likely to lead to longer travel times and even power cuts .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : stoke boss 'delighted ' at summer signing 's impact
text: the stoke city manager mark hughes says he was `` delighted '' to bring eric maxim choupo-moting to the potters this season .
the striker scored twice as stoke ended manchester united 's 100 % start to the new premier league season with a 2-2 draw .
choupo-moting showed he could well be the clinical player the potters have been searching for , after joining on a free transfer .
he [ choupo-moting ] will get the headlines and rightly so because he was a big part of the performance and the result overall .
he should be pleased and i was delighted when i got him here .
it was a decent bit of business . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: hurricane irma : 'pretty bad ' for staffordshire man
text: a staffordshire man who lives in florida has told bbc radio stoke this morning that he 's boarded up his home as he 's facing winds of around 120mph from hurricane irma .
the storm is blasting up the west coast of the state after buffeting the city of miami , with dangerous flooding along long stretches of coast .
more than 3.4 million homes in the state are without power .
mo elesawwy is from newcastle-under-lyme and moved to tampa where he says he 's hoping he 's done enough to withstand the hurricane .
luckily , we 're still with power .
in tampa , i think they said on the news that 260,000 homes are without power now and they probably will be for at least a few days .
it 's pretty bad at the moment . ''
author: Jodie Looker
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke
